1.text: Cut the lemons lengthwise in half with a sharp knife.

2.text: Squeeze the juice out into a bowl if you’re doing it by hand.

3.text: Crush the lemon in a citrus press as an alternative.

4.text: Put the lemon in an electric juicer if you don’t mind pulp.

5.text: Mix water or sugar into the juice if it tastes too sour.

6.text: Store the juice in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

7.text: Juice 6 lemons into a small glass or bowl.

9.text: Combine water and sugar with the lemon zest.

10.text: Heat the pot over medium heat until the water starts to simmer.

11.text: Cook and stir the water for 4 minutes until the sugar dissolves.

12.text: Pour the lemon juice into the pot.

13.text: Put the juice into the refrigerator or freezer until it is cold.

14.text: Drink or use the juice after it has had a chance to chill.

15.text: Choose heavy varieties of lemons to get more juice out of them.

16.text: Pick lemons that feel soft but not mushy.

17.text: Freeze the lemons until you’re ready to juice them.

18.text: Thaw the lemons by microwaving them for about 30 seconds.

19.text: Press and roll the lemons on a cutting board to free more of the juice.
